citation.article-title: Proposal of the genus Thermoactinomyces sensu stricto and three new genera, Laceyella, Thermoflavimicrobium and Seinonella, on the basis of phenotypic, phylogenetic and chemotaxonomic analyses
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Thermoactinomyces Tsilinsky 1899
Cells are aerobic, Gram-positive, non-acid-fast and chemo-organotrophic.
Aerial mycelium is abundant and white.
Well-developed, branched and septate substrate mycelium is formed.
Endospores are sessile and formed singly on aerial and substrate hyphae or on unbranched short sporophores.
Growth occurs at 55 °C but not at 30 °C.
Further descriptive information is given by Lacey & Cross (1989).
Additional characters found in this study are as follows.
Major fatty acid is iso-C15 : 0, and significant amounts of iso-C17 : 0 are present.
Two species are assigned to the emended genus Thermoactinomyces: Thermoactinomyces vulgaris and Thermoactinomyces intermedius.
The DNA G+C content of the type strains of Thermoactinomyces vulgaris and Thermoactinomyces intermedius is 48 mol% (determined by HPLC in this study).
The type species is Thermoactinomyces vulgaris Tsilinsky 1899.
